comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
Cruiser USS Pennsylvania Glenn Curtiss February 17,1911 San Diego , California
" The test was made to show the Navy Department that the aeroplane equipped like that of Curtiss does not need an especially constructed platform on a ship's deck to make it of practical use to the Navy" ( New York Daily Tribune February 18,1911)
Glenn Curtiss:   " In making the test I used an experimental machine fitted with the same type of float  and hydro -surfaces used in my successful water flights with the exception that I placed  the propeller in front of the planes instead  of behind, as in the case of the standard Curtiss machine."  ( New York Evening World February 18, 1911) 
{Clearly visible in this photo}
